text: Hello everyone, I am today's keynote speaker, Jason Hong.
I am now a Ph.D. student at the University of Michigan.
I am also a Project Taira staff member.
Project Taira stands for the Taiwanese Young Researchers Association.
The purpose of today's event is to provide suggestions and feedback.
We hope that Project Taira will continue to grow and improve.
At the beginning, I would like to talk about what Project Taira is currently doing,
and what questions we would like to ask.
This video is the summary of Project Taira.
We hope to establish a timely cross-national academic information sharing platform,
to connect with Taiwanese academics from all over the world,
to communicate about the development, results, and trends of overseas and Taiwan academic circles,
and to provide each other with an effective platform for communication.
This is basically the purpose of Project Taira.
We hope that young Taiwanese academics from all over the world can come to this platform,
and share information with each other.
